name: Queen of the Colorless Fire - The Oracle of Istus: Rogue3 / Cleric35 / Monk2
author: grizzled_dwarflord

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Queen of the Colorless Fire – The Oracle of Istus

In the ancient days of Oerth, there waged a decades long war between the Baklunish and the Suel.  The Suloise Mages of Power, who practiced a kind of magic unknown to the present day, created a terrible cataclysm remembered as the Invoked Devastation. The details of this calamity are unclear, except the fertile heartlands of the Baklunish empire were transformed into the Dry Steppes, her great cities and rivers now entirely gone. There are not even ruins to mark the graves of ancient Baklunish civilization; Tovag Baragu stands alone where there was once a capital city.  The kingdoms of the dwarves in the northern Crystalmists and Sulhauts were also devastated, and the legendary Axe of the Dwarven Lords was lost.
 
In retribution, the magi-priests of the Bakluni gathered within the stone circles of Tovag Baragu and conjured a mighty working, bringing down the terrible Rain of Colorless Fire upon the Suloise basin. This Rain burned people, buildings, even rocks and soil to ash, leaving the Sea of Dust as a monument to the hubris of Man. Together, the Invoked Devastation and the Rain of Colorless Fire are known as the Twin Cataclysms.
 
And thus ended the Baklunish-Suloise Wars.
 
Those few Bakluni who survived were the wayward mystics, ascendant priests, and oracles of the Baklunish goddess of Fate, Time and Space, The Lady of Our Fate, the Colorless and the All-Colored—Istus.  And none were more powerful than Oracle Queen who was nearly a celestial in her own right….

Oracle Queen of Istus

 
Title:  Queen of the Colorless Fire – The Oracle of Istus
AKA: The Sojourn Ascendant, Celestial of Istus
Classes: Rogue 3 / Cleric 35 / Monk 2
Race: Human (or Half-elf)
Alignment: Any Lawful
XP Penalty: 0
Playable 1-40, PvM
 
Attributes
Str10
Int14
Wis18 (38)
Dex10
Con12
Chr8
 
Domains: Travel & Knowledge (true domains of Istus)
 
Level Guide
1 Rogue 1, Expertise, Improved Expertise
2 Cleric 1
3 Cleric 2, Extend Spell
4 Cleric 3, Wis19
5 Cleric 4
6 Cleric 5, Zen Archery
7 Monk 1
8 Cleric 6, Wis20
9 Cleric 7, SF: Evocation
10 Cleric 8
11 Cleric 9
12 Cleric 10, Empower Spell, Wis21
13 Cleric 11
14 Cleric 12
15 Cleric 13, Silent Spell
16 Cleric 14, Wis22
17 Monk 2
18 Cleric 15 Greater Spell Focus: Evocation
19 Cleric 16
20 Cleric 17, Wis23
21 Cleric 18, Epic Spell Focus: Evocation
22 Rogue 2
23 Cleric 19
24 Cleric 20, Epic Skill Focus: Concentration, Wis24
25 Cleric 21
26 Cleric 22,
27 Cleric 23, Great Wis I, Great Wis II
28 Cleric 24, Wis27
29 Cleric 25
30 Cleric 26, Great Wis III, Great Wis IV
31 Cleric 27
32 Cleric28, Wis30
33 Cleric 29, Great Wis V, Great Wis VI
34 Cleric 30
35 Cleric 31
36 Cleric 32, Great Wis VII, Great Wis VIII, Wis35
37 Rogue 3
38 Cleric 33
39 Cleric 34, Great Wis IX
40 Cleric 35, Great Wis X, Wis38
 
Combat Vitals
Ranged AB: 37/32/27
Enhanced Ranged Mode: 63/58/53/63/58
Base Melee AB: 23/20/17/14/11
Enhanced Melee AB: 49/46/43/40/37/49/46
Spell Resistance: 47
Naked AC: 32
Buffed AC in +5 environment: 77
HP: 356
 
Skill Set: 255 skill points total
Concentration: 43 (54)
Discipline: 0
Disable Trap: 22
Listen: 5 (19)
Open Lock: 5
Search: 5 (7)
Spot: 40 (52)
Heal: 1 (15)
Set Trap: 20
Spellcraft: 43 (45_
Tumble: 40
UMD: 31
 
Saves          (vs spells)
Fort:     24     (33)
Reflex: 20     (29)
Will:     37     (46)
 
Max Spell DCs
Hammer of the Gods: 40
Empowered Blade Barriers: 42
Implosion: 48
 
Base Spell Slots with +12 to Wisdom:
1st: 11
2nd: 11
3rd: 11
4th: 11
5th: 10
6th: 9
7th: 9
8th: 9
9th: 8 – that’s 8 Implosions…
 
Strengths
Highest Evocation DCs possible for a Faith Caster
Most Spell Slots Possible
Very High AC
Strong Skill Set
Can still melee riffraff if needed
Matures early and often
52 unbuffed Spot
 
Weaknesses:
No Discipline (if you want it, I would move you last Monk level to Level 37, and siphon from one of your other skills)
Lowish Hit Points, but with a good Constitution item and an Empowered Endurance, you can almost scrape 600hp.
No innate Concealment – must rely on items, scrolls, etc.
 
Builder’s Commentary
 
While most players tend to play their clerics as battle masters, there is something uniquely gratifying when playing a caster cleric that can achieve a 50 Wisdom, 8 Implosions with 48 DCs, 18 Harms in the backpocket, and 9 Empowered Blade Barriers that average around 100 points per swipe at a 42 DC.  In many ways, Clerics make betters Evokers than mages.  Drawing upon the lore of Istus, Goddess of Fate and Destiny of Oerth, this is another variation on an Imploder cleric.  Highest DCs possible.  Very High AC thanks to Wisdom, Haste, Improved Expertise.  A ranged AB that, when enhanced, is more than enough to gain someone’s attention.  Silent Spell to aid in Spellbook management.  UMD for those who can’t live without it.  Really the only thing missing is Craft Wand.  In my non-umd version, Craft Wand is attainable (I give up Rogue altogether and take a Ranger level pre-epic).
 
The saves are very modest with the Will obviously the eye-popper.  Reflex is bolstered by Evasion, Prot. From Alignment and Spellcraft, while Fort, in addition to Spellcraft, is further bolstered by Endurance, Prot. From Alignment, Death Ward and Negative Energy Protection.
 
This is a very powerful caster cleric.  The high AC provides a kind of natural resistance to criticals.  While I posted base melee AB stats, one wouldn’t be engaging in much melee other than with your normal riff-raff.  You’ll be sending your foes to meet their fates by using your dirtnap spells – Empowered Blades, Harms and Silent Harms, Implosions.  You’ll control the battlefield with Hammers and Words of Faith.  And you’ll be weakening your opponent from a ranged position with your ranged weapon.
 
From a powergamer perspective -- and if you are not bound by Domain choices -- one could swap Knowledge with Trickery to make the Oracle truly unhittable.  In such an instance, I would also recommend dropping Extend for Craft Wand to garner a poor man’s HiPS with Wands of Invis/Improved Invis.
 
There’s a few builds similar and only one build like this and it is MorteMeister’s Artful Dodger:  The title doesn’t really do that build justice.  This is more or less a retooling of that excellent build.  This one retains all of that’s build’s goodness, but gets better Fort and Will saves, more hit points, Zen Archery, and Epic Skill Focus in Concentration.  I also make some different skill choices to maximize the Rogue in this.  Hopefully the Oracle is just different enough to merit inclusion in the guild.
 
Others tend to delay Monk and Rogue until the end.  That’s all fine and dandy, but I prefer to play my characters from the ground up so I’ll try to scatter those classes throughout the build.
 
Another build similar is the Divine Caster Crook
The Evasive All-Seeing Phae: 
Maximilian’s Demolition Man:  (another example of waiting until build’s end to take a Rogue level)
In all of the above listed, they used the old trick of stacking UEF for high AC.  That is no longer a thing (was fixed somewhere between 1.67-1.69).
 
Finally, may folks prefer to play their Clerics as warriors on steroids.  There are very valid reasons for that.  I tend to find in Epics that they lack a certain punching power when it comes to bosses and high-end mobs (we’re talking solo now).  With a pure and raw casting cleric, they have that punch in the Epics that one wants.  They maintain a variety of ways of dealing with casters with low Fort saves, high end melee warriors with low reflex or will, and something for everyone in between. Cheers, lads!

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
I am a big fan of Cleric caster builds especially ones with a splash of Monk and Sneaker. I tend to either do the 1 monk and 1 assassin dip or take 3 monk for that extra smidge of movement speed to stay ahead of the bad guys on a zen archery build myself.

I am curious how Improved Expertise works out for in this build. I have, previously, discounted it but it has always sat in the back of my head as something I should try out.

Also, do you run a sling/shield or a bow?


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
For weapons, I use Kama for the monk attack schedule.  No shields so as not to lose the Monk abilities.  For ranged, I tend to favor sling, but crossbows and shortbows work in this.  Deflect Arrow is not available when using any of the ranged weapons.  It's funny because I have about 4 variations of this build, some with 4 Monk/1 Ranger, or 3 Monk/Rogue2, with both getting 1 better AB both ranged and melee.  

For Expertise/Improved Expertise: I tend to keep these on unless I'm actually trying to hit something.  What's interesting is that for Touch Attacks (Inflict Wounds, Harm, etc) are not penalized for Expertise/Improved Expertise, so it's quite nice to dodge in amongst your foes with this turned on while handing at Harms and Silent Harms.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
grizzled_dwarflord wrote:For weapons, I use Kama for the monk attack schedule.  No shields so as not to lose the Monk abilities.  For ranged, I tend to favor sling, but crossbows and shortbows work in this.  Deflect Arrow is not available when using any of the ranged weapons.
I’ll need to test it on a non-custom server but I believe shuriken gives you zen archery, deflect arrow AND uncapped Strength bonus.
grizzled_dwarflord wrote: For Expertise/Improved Expertise: I tend to keep these on unless I'm actually trying to hit something.  What's interesting is that for Touch Attacks (Inflict Wounds, Harm, etc) are not penalized but Expertise/Improved Expertise, so it's quite nice to dodge in amongst your foes with this turned on while handing at Harms and Silent Harms.
And there is the reason, thanks, I will need to play around with that.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
This looks like a great build GDL, very playable throughout its lifespan
Thanks for the comments on playstyle, very informative for those of us learning

In terms of suggestions:
I suggest dropping Set Trap down to 15 modified unless you are planning to set traps without Take 20 (ie during combat)
I consider putting UMD to 33 modified unless casting from UMD does not have failure (as is the case in an environment we both play in) then UMD 30 modified might be enough

Thanks for sharing with us your experience Expertise/Improved Expertise doesn't interfere with touch attacks I was very curious about that

Managed to dig this one up from NWN Wiki: Expertise (Talk)
Spellcasting Attacks 
Unless I'm mistaken, a rare few spells do use attack rolls (mainly touch attacks); would this apply the penalty to such touch attacks? If so, that would mean that spellcasters might actually face a mild penalty to using it even if the module allows spellcasting with Expertise.... 67.2.102.241 08:09, July 20, 2012 (UTC)
  • Touch attacks are not penalized by expertise, power attack, etc. Thus a spell-caster stands only to gain from this feat. The full list of modifiers is stated in the touch attack article. WhiZard (talk) 14:59, July 20, 2012 (UTC)
I take it the boosted BAB value from Divine Power (and any bonus Str modifier) will apply if a Harm melee touch attack is attempted?
Pretty good to know these things!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Well, the Touch Attack is : BAB + strength modifier (only if positive) + nature sense + epic prowess (unless a ranged weapon is equipped) + unarmed weapon focus feats (if unarmed or using a creature weapon) + effects.

So the BAB boost from DP should apply.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
Was looking at this gal for WoG last night and trying to find a way to get travel and trickery.  Couldnt find an easy way without losing 40 skill points and a feat (ie.. going non-human)

So I might just have to go with GDL suggestions for Istus's true domains and take the Knowledge and Travel.    It was either that or Obad-Hai for Animal and Plant.

Still a toss up whether I want Haste or Improved Invis more.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Animal and plant would be way better for a zen archer, I think
Empowered summons, extra AC, cats, true seeing as a lvl 3 spell and creeping doom

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Not trying to get off topic here, but I do have a question about Touch attacks (ala Harm, for example, which could apply here).

If one is Hasted, one could caste 2 Harms in one round, right?

As it is a Touch attack, it is affected by BAB usw.  Is the Touch attack (because there are two in one round) affected by BAB progression, meaning the second is at -5 (and does it take Monk UBAB into account, then, as well)?

I take it a Touch attack can be EDed.  So the only way one could get a Harm to land would be to be Hasted and do two in one round, right?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: Touch attacks aren't affected by attack progression or combat modes and can't be blocked with Epic Dodge. Concealment is the best defence against touch attacks, I usually take Blind Fight on caster clerics even if they aren't built for combat.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
webshaman1 wrote: ↑
Mar 04, 2020
Not trying to get off topic here, but I do have a question about Touch attacks (ala Harm, for example, which could apply here).

If one is Hasted, one could caste 2 Harms in one round, right?

As it is a Touch attack, it is affected by BAB usw.  Is the Touch attack (because there are two in one round) affected by BAB progression, meaning the second is at -5 (and does it take Monk UBAB into account, then, as well)?

I take it a Touch attack can be EDed.  So the only way one could get a Harm to land would be to be Hasted and do two in one round, right?
Touch attacks are not subject to a BAB schedule, but you can land two Harms in one round, provided you hit of course.
conlaoch wrote:Was looking at this gal for WoG last night and trying to find a way to get travel and trickery.  Couldnt find an easy way without losing 40 skill points and a feat (ie.. going non-human)

So I might just have to go with GDL suggestions for Istus's true domains and take the Knowledge and Travel.    It was either that or Obad-Hai for Animal and Plant.

Still a toss up whether I want Haste or Improved Invis more.
Haste (at least in low to mid magic environments).  Haste can last for 35 rounds and up to 70 rounds extended.  You won't find a good substitute for it in your environment.  Improved Invis is much easier to come by because of scroll availability, Dust of Disappearance, and other magic items.  You could always go halfling and give up a feat (Improved Expertise).
Orion2019 wrote:Animal and plant would be way better for a zen archer, I think
Empowered summons, extra AC, cats, true seeing as a lvl 3 spell and creeping doom
This isn't a zen archer, but has zen archery as an attribute.  Still, those are good alternatives if one can access those domains and still remain Lawful.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
on WoG, Obad-Hai Lawful Neutral and gets you Plant and Animal domain

and halfling is possible, but looking at that skillset, I cant for the life of me decide where to get rid of 40 points.

much easier to find a wizard to buy a wand of Improved Invis from.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
Haste, there is a massive difference between haste cast by item and improved invis cast by item.

I personally like Travel/War, on WOG though ... embrace the Halfling and use wands/sequencers for Improved Invis, you will need those slots :)

For skill points, drop starting Wisdom by 2, increase Starting Con and Int by 2. If 1 DC/AC makes a functional difference over the long run it will be be balanced out by +4 Dodge and 50% Concealment being up ... all the time, I am sure.

Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: Iwan
posts.content: Is it possible to move monk 2nd and rogue 3rd lvl to late 30 for skill dump without loosing cleric spellcasting potential? I am thinking about taking cleric on 17 instead of monk and moving this monk level on 38. Will this mess up  the build?

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
You get Rogue 3 at 37 for that. If you also want discipline you can move monk 2 out. Personally I would not have all 3 classes pre epic. I would take 2 rogue pre epic and 2 monk + 1 rogue post epic.


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

I’ll need to test it on a non-custom server but I believe shuriken gives you zen archery, deflect arrow AND uncapped Strength bonus.
Oh, yes, that reminds me, I have been finding some rather nice shuriken where I've been playing lately.  That would actually be a great way to play it.  
Is the wiki incorrect about shurikens? https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Shuriken
The wiki seems to indicate that shurikens aren't supposed to apply the Strength bonus to damage.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Vanilla Shuriken do not add Str bonus (mighty property).

The Shuriken need to be Mighty to do so.
